content.description: This is a splitter good hands boulder problem that starts on a ledge and gains a small overhang before topping out. It was completely dry and not underwater when we climbed these.
content.protection: Sand was pretty soft for bouldering
content.location: This was all the way up and past the acutal lake arm. The second of two large square boulder blocks laying slightly northwest of the large butte next to Explorers Canyon. There is a water buoy that says explorers canyon next to this.  37째22'8.24"N 110째56'30.56"W

content.description: Start this one off right in the water. Gain a small crack while using face holds to establish yourself in the main right leaning crack. There is a good hand jam to establish into the main crack, but its tough to get to. This thing is tight hands rattly fingers.. prepare yourselves. We werent able to top out, just got most the way up before bailing into the water. Relatively clean for a powell route under the white rock.. but ringlocks on this just makes it hard.
content.location: Right past the entrance to Davis Gultch its on the uplake side.

content.description: You absolutely can't miss this wall if going up Escalante. So many huecos and different lines to play on. Some are small and shallow and some are deep enough to sit in. Just shows how unique of a formation this is for Escalante. You could make this 5.7-5.8 at easiest.. for hardness.. well 5.11 and beyond.
content.location: Right side of the canyon when going up Escalante. This is more towards the Beginning/Middle. It's Inbetween Clear Creek and Davis Gultch canyons, closer to Davis Gultch.

content.description: Section of wall with a distinct horizontal row of huecos, with more below and a few above. Possible lines follow huecos to the right, left and center or traverses. A fun spot with lots of opportunity.
content.location: West wall of the Escalante main channel. North of the entrance to Indian Creek Canyon, just before the s-turn towards Clear Creek Canyon entrance.

content.description: This route goes up the arete by gaining a small ledge to the left and using left/right face holds to top out.
content.protection: Soft sand was all that we needed.
content.location: Second Boulder, next to Sinker crack. Block laying slightly northwest of the large butte next to Explorers Canyon. There is a water buoy that says explorers canyon next to this. 37째22'8.24"N 110째56'30.56"W
